reviews.review_msg: I feel like he has improved a lot as i feel like the past ratings didn't really match my experience. During lecture he gave us a lot of space to ask questions and encouraged questions and answered silly questions. he gave a practice midterm and he emphaizes what you NEED to know for exam in lecture. He was also funny sometimes!made me hehehe a few

As usual for this school he is a research professor that does not actually want to teach courses. Zero care was put into explaining any of the concepts if you dont go look for yourself in the book. Zero clue what would be on the exam because he refused to say. Just remove this course or have jason teach it by himself, he is not a good teacher.
The reviews are right

WORST PROF EVER! I mean the rating speaks for itself. I don't even know how he got his job at SFU, and it's funny with the amount of dissatisfaction from the student, SFU's still keeping him. It makes me think of my university like a joke!

this guy making associate prof will mark the death of post-secondary education
what a joke of an instructor
this guy deserves to stay assistant prof for 20 years
one of the worst hires SFU has ever done, esp for graphics/vision faculty

One of the most IRRESPONSIBLE instructors I've ever had. Slides and homework are taken from others. Doesn't prepare for lectures at all. At times he just stares at the slides in silence like he has no idea what is on it. Still, he requires attendance. 1/3 of the term was taught by his grad students. Often late to lectures or end early.

Very bad prof who teaches the computer vision portion (roughly the first half of the semester) of the course. Midterm had a failing average and he gave us NO practice for it and didn't say any specifics of what would be on it. Overall, not a good experience taking this course so far. Do not recommend.
He is not as bad as everyone says but not good either. His teaching is so different from the exams.
my condolences if you take this course
Never seen a worse instructor. Shows zero effort to make things clear for students. Not kind either. You should avoid him at all cause. SFU needs more qualified professors.

Most accurate 1/5 I've seen. Seemed decent at first but doesn't teach anything relevant to his exam and expects you to read research papers and the two textbooks (very dense content). No sample questions, no quiz and no examples in class so you're basically going to the exam blind.

I feel like he cares about the topic a lot which is good. I don't think he deserves a one star. I wish that there were quizzes or some sort of practice tests so we had a better idea of the type of questions he would ask though. There was not a lot of connection between the textbook and test questions.

He is new to teaching and will improve.

Really hard to follow what he's talking about. He makes a simple concept very complicated. The video he provided is too short to understand. No offense I think he is a nice person but as a student who pays to study here, I think we deserve better lectures. Avoid if you can...

Concepts feel incomplete and not taught well. Yagiz doesn't provide any practice materials. It took him more than a month to release our marks. Splitting this course between vision and graphics was a really bad idea. Both topics are highly dense topics and squeezing them into one semester is not practical. Avoid if you can.
Please do not take his course. You've been warned!
You can tell he has passion for this field but he is horrible at explaining
He is a nice person but horrible at explaining concepts. Nobody in the class has any idea what's going on. I'd never take him again

The worst professor ever!! He only gave you overviews of some high level concepts. The textbook has lots of complicated formulas and he never explain how to use or test in exams. This is just an INTRODUCTION to computer vision course, not PhD course, so we are not supposed to read all the complicated papers and understand them ourselves.

It has been 3 months since the semester has started, no portion of the course has been graded thus far. Course material highly detached from examination as the material in class is very high level overview whereas the exams are heavy in math. It's been 3 months since the beginning of the semester and I have no idea how good/bad I'm doing.

He's not that bad. Honestly.
First things first, this course is mostly self taught.
Youtube videos are good quality wise. Content wise it is very good at covering high leveled topics but a bit lackluster on the low level topics.
Most of the comments here talks about his ego, but I don't see any of it so far in his course.
Midterm difficulty was ok.

Professor teaches high level basic overviews of topics. Instead of explaining them he expects you to self learn all of them. Purposefully leaves out information and then tests students on this. Does not provide any sample questions whatsoever. CAP5415 lecture playlist on YouTube will save you.

Will be an unpopular opinion here but I like the prof as a person, very passionate about the material,responsible in class and willing to answer questions. His YouTube videos explain concepts clearly and vividly and will likely pass on to future generations. However, if you want to take an easy course for credit this course is probably not for you.
the worst professor i have met ever, grade my project without reading the codes and implementing it. weird accent

He gives a good high-level overview of the topics in the lectures, and you can tell he is passionate about the topics Assignments standard difficulty Midterm and final are awful, the averages were 40%. Questions are impossible to answer with just lecture content. Don't recommend this prof unless okay with self teaching everything or bad marks.
Very bad. VERYBAD

Being in his class was high-key the worst experience that I've ever had in a class at SFU. I've never seen a professor with such an attitude and sassiness towards his students. He poorly explains his material and expects a lot from his students. No wonder why class morale is so low after his vision lectures. Avoid him if you can.

Terrible. Just don't take him. Look at the other reviews, they're 100% accurate. This guy needs to seriously reevaluate his style of teaching. Or just stop teaching altogether and focus on your research. I'd like to erase this course from my memory now. Can't believe I paid money for this.

Very rude and angry professor. Puts absolutely no effort into teaching. Yagiz Aksoy's "lectures" are only around 10-15 minutes, which does not teach me anything at all. And I have to pay full tuition for this? If you want to pursue graphics, take an online course instead. Yagiz will ruin graphics & computer vision for you.
Assignments are vague, exam was unfair as we didn't have extra time for uploading and submission. Class avg for the midterm was 39%.. He doesn't seem to care about his students. Avoid if you can!
Don't you just love a professor who doesn't explain things in detail and let you read a book that is about as confusing as his lectures are.

He provides short pre-recorded lectures on YouTube that are kinda hard to follow due to his accent. He is not very helpful on piazza either. He has strict midterm guidelines that don't make sense with the time constraint. We have to take selfies with our answers on papers and then upload each image on Coursys with no extra upload time.
Really short lectures. Really hard to understand course material. Lectures skipped important details. Had to watch free lectures from udacity. Avoid him!

Disappointed by his rude behavior towards students. I do not know why he is aggressive so much? I respect the fact that you are a professor, but that does not mean you should treat everybody else as inferior to you.

The worst Instructor I have ever met, everything copied from CS188, but did not provide any help. he seldom answer question in piazza. he is lazy but extremely strict. This course itself puts a lot of pressure on us. he didn't provide any help, just give us a Berkeley link. the only thing he did is to keep adding difficulties and pressure to us

After the course was converted into online class, he disappeared. CS188 lasts for six months but we have three months and no effective help. He does't spend any time thinking about how to teach better, but making lots of complicated and strict examination rules, and he would fail people without hesitation, even under this situation. Avoid him!!!!!

Yes, like the other reviews said there wasn't enough time for the exam and he wasn't the most accommodating. By the end though, he removed a lot of restrictions and listened to student feedback on Piazza. He was also fairly active on there with answering questions. The move to online courses due to COVID-19 was not handled well by him though.

During my time at SFU this prof was the worst prof. The only thing he's good at is talking about AD Basically he doesn't do anything except copying and using UCB lectures No quizzes, no sample exams(Too lazy to write one), The only good thing about his classes is his voice(very quite and sleepy) which makes his class perfect for sleeping and gmng

The course was instructed in an unreasonably lazy manor. You are literally paying money to teach yourself everything. No problem sets, exams or quizzes were given in class, and we were directly pushed into taking a ridiculously hard final which was worth a huge chunk of the class! Steer clear!!

Do not fall for the good ratings for this prof. He basically only showed up and asked us if we had questioned, expected us to learn from a FREE set of lecture slides from Berkeley, didnt even put in effort to teach us during these hard times. The final was insanely short, with four difficult questions where you had to just read for half of the time

Too hard as an introductory course for AI. The slides were taken from UC Berkeley and he put bare minimum effort when teaching. Better off going over the material from Berkeley's website than going to class. The course was designed for a 4 credit course, but was taught as a 3 credit course. Overall horrible experience wouldnt recommend it to anyone

His lecture slides were directly copied from the UC Berkley's intro to AI class, which wouldn't be a problem except that the prereqs were different and we weren't given the full content. All the exam practise problems were from UCB, and were virtually impossible to solve and the final exam was the main deciding factor for grades.

He doesn't care about his class. Lectures and projects are taken from UC Berkeley's CS188. While other professors tried to find a way to give online lectures during COVID-19, he sent us the playlist of Berkeley's CS188 video lectures. He doesn't respect his students. Taking this course is like paying for a free online course and the credits.

He puts zero effort in his classes and doesn't care about the students at all. All the material is copied from cs188 Berkeley and even though the video lectures from cs188 Berkeley class are from 2014, they are way better than his lectures. Do not take his course with him, I repeat DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE WITH HIM.
His lecture slides, assignments, lectures, videos, demos and even autograders were taken from Berkeley's online free lecture. He puts minimal effort to his class
